packagegui.title: OpenVPN: Client-specific configuration
packagegui.delete_string: An OpenVPN client-specific configuration has been deleted.
packagegui.addedit_string: An OpenVPN client-specific configuration has been created/modified.

field.description: Set this option to disable this client-specific configuration without removing it from the list.
Enter the client's X.509 common name here.
Check this to block (disable) this client, based on its common name. Don't use this option to disable a client due to key or password compromise. Use a CRL (certificate revocation list) instead.
Setting this option will make this client not inherit the global push options.

Set this option to push an IP to the client's interface. Expressed as a CIDR range (e.g. 10.5.0.0/16). The first IP in the range will be used as the remote IP of the interface, and the second IP will be used as the local IP of the interface.
You can put your own custom options here, separated by semi-colons (;). They'll be added to the client-specific configuration.
You may enter a description here for your reference (not parsed).
